item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I never found beauty in longing for the impossible and never found the possible to be beyond my reach." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Never ask people about your work." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Siva add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Love is the answer, but while you are waiting for the answer, sex raises some pretty good questions." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Siva add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Siva add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Don't fool yourself, my dear. You're much worse than a bitch. You're a saint. Which shows why saints are dangerous and undesirable." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "My dear, I don't give a damn." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Siva add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Siva add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Siva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Siva add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Siva add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Siva add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Siva add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Siva add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Siva add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "Think of all the beauty still left around you and be happy." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Siva add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Siva add a quote by Kent M. Keith
item.description:
"The Paradoxical Commandments
People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.
If you do good, people will accuse you of selfish ulterior motives. Do good anyway.
If you are successful, you will win false friends and true enemies. Succeed anyway.
The good you do today will be forgotten tomorrow. Do good anyway.
Honesty and frankness make you vulnerable. Be honest and frank anyway.
The biggest men and women with the biggest ideas can be shot down by the smallest men and women with the smallest minds. Think big anyway.
People favor underdogs but follow only top dogs. Fight for a few underdogs anyway.
What you spend years building may be destroyed overnight. Build anyway.
People really need help but may attack you if you do help them. Help people anyway.
Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth. Give the world the best you have anyway." -- Kent M. Keith

item.title: Siva add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: Siva add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Siva add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "There are no evil thoughts, Mr. Rearden," Francisco said softly, "except one: the refusal to think." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Who is John Galt?" -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I started my life with a single absolute: that the world was mine to shape in the image of my highest values and never to be given up to a lesser standard, no matter how long or hard the struggle." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Let me give you a tip on a clue to men's characters: the man who damns money has obtained it dishonorably; the man who respects it has earned it." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The hardest thing to explain is the glaringly evident which everybody has decided not to see." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Siva add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The truth is not for all men but only for those who seek it." -- Ayn Rand
